q1: How do I convert MPG to L/100km?
a1: L/100km = 235.215 / MPG (US). For example, 30 MPG ≈ 7.84 L/100km.
q2: What is the difference between US and Imperial MPG?
a2: Imperial gallons are larger (4.546 L vs 3.785 L), so Imperial MPG numbers are higher for the same vehicle.
a4: L/100km is an inverse measure — lower numbers mean better efficiency, unlike MPG where higher is better.
